means: 醒来，唤醒( rouse的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The musicians burst into a rousing rendition of "Paddy Casey's Reel".
sentence.Network_cn: 这些音乐家激情演绎了《帕迪·凯西的里尔舞曲》。

sentence.Network_en: He was greeted with a rousing chorus of Happy Birthday.
sentence.Network_cn: 迎接他的是大家齐唱《祝你生日快乐》，令他非常感动。

sentence.Network_en: Critics have accused him of rabble-rousing.
sentence.Network_cn: 评论家谴责他煽动群众。

entry.def: If someone rouses you when you are sleeping or if you rouse, you wake up.

example.ex: Hilton roused him at eight-thirty by rapping on the door...
example.tran: 希尔顿8点半敲门把他叫醒了。

example.ex: When I put my hand on his, he stirs but doesn't quite rouse.
example.tran: 当我把手放到他手上时，他动了动，但并没有完全醒来。

entry.tran: 使自己活跃起来;让自己振作
entry.def: If you rouse yourself, you stop being inactive and start doing something.

example.ex: She seemed to be unable to rouse herself to do anything...
example.tran: 她似乎打不起精神去做任何事情。

example.ex: He roused himself from his lazy contemplation of the scene beneath him...
example.tran: 他不再懒洋洋地注视着下面的景色。

entry.tran: 使激动;鼓动;煽动;使振奋
entry.def: If something or someone rouses you, they make you very emotional or excited.

example.ex: He did more to rouse the crowd there than anybody else...
example.tran: 他比其他任何人都更积极地鼓动那里的群众。

example.ex: Ben says his father was good-natured, a man not quickly roused to anger or harsh opinions.
example.tran: 本说他父亲的脾气温和，不轻易发火或是发表尖锐的意见。

entry.def: If something rouses a feeling in you, it causes you to have that feeling.

example.ex: It roused a feeling of rebellion in him...
This roused my interest in politics and I went to work for the Democrats.
example.tran: 这激发了我对政治的兴趣，于是我开始效力于民主党。

sentences.sentence: "the purpose of art is the arousal of emotions"

means.word_mean: 1. capable of arousing enthusiasm or excitement;

sentences.sentence: "stirring events such as wars and rescues"

means.word_mean: 2. rousing to activity or heightened action as by spurring or goading;

sentences.sentence: "tossed a rousing political comment into the conversation"

auth_sentence.content: "Daddy Fox" provides a suitably rousing introduction.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Daddy Fox" provides a suitably rousing introduction.

auth_sentence.content: Oliver Thomas, declared to a rousing cheer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Oliver Thomas, declared to a rousing cheer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Oliver Thomas, declared to a rousing cheer.

auth_sentence.content: Bryce hollered like a cheerleader rousing a crowd.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bryce hollered like a cheerleader rousing a crowd.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bryce hollered like a cheerleader rousing a crowd.

sentences.en: The audience gave the band a rousing welcome.
The players were greeted by rousing cheers.
sentences.cn: 演员们受到热烈的欢呼。

sentences.en: The returning soldiers enjoyed a rousing reception.
sentences.cn: 归来的战士们受到了热烈的欢迎。

sentences.en: a rousing finale to an evening of enthralling music
sentences.cn: 令人心醉的音乐晚会激动人心的终曲

sentences.en: In a rousing speech the minister hit out at racism in the armed forces.
sentences.cn: 在一次振奋人心的讲话中，部长严厉批评了军队中存在的种族主义。

sentences.en: In a rousing speech,the President hit out against the trade union.
sentences.cn: 在一次令人振奋的讲话中,总统对工会进行了猛烈的抨击。
